title: Jack Dorsey and Mark Zuckerberg will face Congress again, this time about the election
text: After giving in to the looming threat of subpoenas, two of tech's most high profile CEOs will again be grilled by Congress. On Tuesday, the Senate Judiciary Committee will host Twitter's Jack Dorsey and Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg for what's likely to be another multi-hour airing of assorted grievances.

title: Cyclical stocks may be racing higher, but tech is still expected to be a long-term winner
text: FANG stocks may be lagging, but don't count technology stocks out.

title: Congress will grill the CEOs of Facebook and Twitter on Tuesday during a hearing on content moderation hearing â€” here's how to watch and what to expect (FB, TWTR)
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey will appear in front of Congress on Tuesday for a virtual hearing on how the social media companies moderate content. The Senate Judiciary Committee scheduled the hearing following a New York Post story, published on October 14 about Joe Biden's son, which contained dubious claims that Hunter Biden was working with Ukrainian officials. Twitter and Facebook's handling of the article fueled the right's ongoing, oft-disproven theory that the tech industry discriminates against conservative content on their platforms, a notion that President Donald Trump has amplified since Twitter began fact-checking his posts in May. Republican lawmakers will likely grill the tech leaders over what they say is censorship of right-leaning posts.

title: Facebook and Twitter CEOs set to testify on Capitol Hill: Can Section 230 be fixed?
text: Santa Clara University School of Law Professor Eric Goldman discusses Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey testifying on Capitol Hill and the challenges with Section 230. title: New Premium Guru Li Lu's 4 Holdings
text: Li Lu (Trades, Portfolio), founder of Himalaya Capital, disclosed four positions in his third-quarter 13-F filing: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ:FB), Micron Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:MU), Bank of America Inc. (NYSE:BAC) and Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG).

title: Facebook, Twitter CEOs to visit Congress again: How to watch on Tuesday
text: Mark Zuckerberg and Jack Dorsey will appear before a Senate committee on Tuesday at 10 a.m. ET/7 a.m. PT.
